author: Staff Reporter
text:
As many as 48 polling booths in all the six Assembly constituencies in the district would be relocated, said District Election Officer and Collector V. Dakshinamoorthy here.

Chairing a meeting with political parties, he said that there are 1,569 polling booths located in 638 polling stations. Based on the proposals sent recently for relocation of booths, the Election Commission of India (ECI) has permitted relocation of 27 polling booths and shifting of 21 polling booths to nearby buildings. The ECI has also permitted renaming 177 polling booths.

Mr. Dakshinamoorthy asked the members of political parties to follow the model code of conduct and not to indulge in hate speeches. He urged them to desist from attacking individuals during their campaigns. Meetings should not disturb traffic and the public.

Complaints

The Collector said that the election control room has so far received 106 complaints and action has been taken against 102 complaints. Four model polling booths would be established in each constituency and six women special polling booths would be established in the district, he added.

Superintendent of Police S. Maheswaran, District Revenue Officer K. Palanisamy, returning officers for six assembly constituencies, election Tahsildar Sugumar, representatives of political parties and election officials participated.
title: 48 polling booths to be relocated in Namakkal
